alert.note: Alert for Estancia Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:05PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG MICROBURST WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CIBOLA, VALENCIA, SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL, SOUTHERN SANTA FE, NORTHWESTERN SOCORRO, BERNALILLO AND NORTHWESTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM MDT... At 604 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking virga showers and a couple dry thunderstorms along a line extending from near Santa Fe to Albuquerque and Socorro. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Valencia, Santa Fe, Los Lunas, Socorro, Corrales, Bernalillo, Belen and Los Ranchos De Albuquerque. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 124 and 191. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 143 and 290. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 287 and 290. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 38. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 89 and 191. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong microburst winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
